column6: Average hours of training per year per employee
Programs for upgrading employee skills and transition assistance programs
column13: In FY23, a comprehensive capability program commenced, and a roadmap is in place to build the capabilities required to deliver AGL's assets development pipeline and low-carbon energy hubs (refer to the Assets scorecard). The capability program will continue in FY24 to ensure AGL is positioned to build, attract, and retain critical capability and identify opportunities to upskill and reskill employees to develop the capabilities required for new and existing energy industries.
column20: Capability program, Roadmap\nAsset development pipeline, Low-carbon energy hubs

column6: Percentage of employees receiving regular performance and career development reviews
Diversity of governance bodies and employees
column13: AGL recognises that a diverse workforce with a broad range of experience and perspectives has a better opportunity to understand and engage AGL's customers and the communities in which it works.AGL also recognises that an inclusive culture creates the conditions for diverse perspectives to be leveraged to solve complex challenges and harness the opportunities the energy sector faces.

column6: Diversity of governance bodies and employees
column13: AGL's Diversity and Inclusion Policy describes AGL's approach to diversity and inclusion and how these attributes are to be embedded in AGL workplaces. It provides a framework to effectively embed and support a diverse and inclusive workplace for all employees. It describes behaviours, including discrimination, harassment, and bullying, that are unlawful and unacceptable at AGL.
column20: Diversity and Inclusion Policy, Workplace diversity, Inclusion practices, Policy framework

column6: Diversity of governance bodies and employees
column13: AGL's Diversity and Inclusion Policy describes AGL's approach to diversity and inclusion and how these attributes are to be embedded in AGL workplaces. It provides a framework to effectively embed and support a diverse and inclusive workplace for all employees. It describes behaviours, including discrimination, harassment, and bullying, that are unlawful and unacceptable at AGL.
column20: Diversity & Inclusion Council, Diverse workforce, Inclusive culture

column6: Diversity of governance bodies and employees
column13: AGL's FY24-26 strategic theme for diversity and inclusion is Inclusivity for Impact, which positions diversity and inclusion as a strategic and everyday enabler of performance at AGL. AGL has a clear aspiration for six diversity dimensions, supported by Employee Network groups from across its diverse workforce.
column20: Diversity and inclusion, Inclusivity for Impact, Performance enabler

column6: Ratio of basic salary and remuneration of women to men
column7: AGL has maintained a 0% gap in pay equity for like-for-like roles for the fourth consecutive year.

column6: Incidents of discrimination and corrective actions taken
column7: In 2023, AGL reported 34 major IT incidents, 30 Environmental Regulatory Reportable (ERR) incidents, and four administrative non-compliance events.

column4: Freedom of Association and Collective Bargaining
column6: Operations and suppliers in which the right to freedom of association and collective bargaining may be at risk
column13: As noted within AGL's Human Rights Policy, AGL believes protecting and upholding human rights within our operations and supply chains is vital to realising human rights for our people, the people we work with, our customers and the communities in which we operate. To deliver on this belief, AGL used risk indicators to identify and validate our modern slavery risk exposure in critical areas of our operations and supply chains.
column20: Human Right Policy, Risk indicators, Modern slavery

column6: Operations and suppliers at significant risk for incidents of child labor
column13: AGL engages offshore labour through third parties in geographies that are inherently more likely to face modern slavery risks. Accordingly, workers may be subject to forced labour or child labour. AGL has comparatively less visibility over practices employed through these arrangements outside of Australia.
column20: Offshore Labour, Third-party engagement, Modern slavery risks\t

column6: Operations and suppliers ar significant risk for incidents of forced or compulsory labor
column13: AGL utilises third-party recruitment firms to engage on-shore contingent labour. s. For example, the risk of forced labour may be relatively higher when third parties are committed to providing labour. In addition, workers may be engaged to work in remote areas, which may significantly increase the complexity of required oversight by AGL as well as by regulators, unions and third-party labour providers due to the remoteness of a site.
column20: Third-party recruitment firms, On-shore contingent labor, Forced labor risk

column6: Security personnel trained in human rights policies or procedures
Incidents of violations involving rights of indigenous peoples
column13: AGL is enhancing its management of indigenous cultural heritage by collaborating with Traditional Owner groups, updating standards and methodologies, and implementing employee training programs. It includes establishing a GIS database, updating cultural heritage standards, improving site inductions, and conducting training on legal requirements and cultural heritage management.\t
column20: Indigenous cultural heritage, Traditional Owner groups, Community expectations

column6: Operations that have been subject to human rights reviews or impacts assessments
column13: AGL used risk indicators to identify and validate our modern slavery risk exposure in critical areas of our operations and supply chains. AGL has identified key risk areas for modern slavery: offshore labour, the solar supply chain, and sourcing batteries and solar-related products.

column6: Employee training on human rights policies or procedures
column7: During the reporting period, AGL's Modern Slavery SMEs designed and implemented targeted training across various business areas.

column6: Significant investment agreements and contracts that include human rights clauses or that underwent human rights screening
Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: AGL continues proactively engaging with our communities through well-established community consultative committees and community dialogue groups. As we embark on new projects to deliver the commitments of our Climate Transition Action Plan, AGL will develop comprehensive community engagement strategies for each project to meaningfully engage and consult with key stakeholders, local communities and Traditional Owners in the proposed project locations.
column20: Community engagement, Proactive engagement, Community Consultative Committees

column6: Operations with significant actual and potential negative impacts on local communities
New suppliers that were screened using social criteria
column13: AGL sets out the minimum Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) standards of behaviour required from all our suppliers and specifically calls out our commitment to work with suppliers who share our values and commitments. Its scope covers ethical business, human rights, labour practices, modern slavery, supply chain and supplier diversity, and community engagement expectations.
column20: Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG), Supplier standards, Values and commitments

column6: Negative social impacts in the supply chain and actions taken
Political contributions
column13: AGL proactively engages with governments regularly, providing policy and technical input for government regulatory settings and pathways to net zero. Ensuring trusted relations with governments and the public service is an essential form of risk mitigation and provides a two-way flow of information relating to policy settings. In line with our long-standing Political Donations Policy, we have not made any political donations (monetary or in-kind) over FY23.
column20: Government engagement, Regulatory settings, Pathways to net zero

column6: Assessment of the health and safety impacts of product and service categories
column13: AGL seeks to engage, share, and learn from other stakeholders in the sectors where it operates. We have strengthened targeted health and safety forums with our significant contractors. A major initiative in which AGL collaborated with our peers resulted in SafeWork Australia commencing the development of a national guide for safer solar installations.\t
column20: SafeWork Australia, Solar installations, Health and safety forums

column6: Incidents of non-compliance concerning the health and safety impacts of products and services
column7: No health and safety Significant Incident and Fatality (SIF) events occurred in FY23.

column7: AGL has achieved a high level of stability throughout the year with a significant reduction of major incidents from 50 incidents in FY22 to 34 incidents in FY23.\t

Substantiated complaints concerning breaches of customer privacy and losses of customer data
column13: AGL manages our information and technology assets and systems in alignment with the Australian Energy Sector Cyber Security Framework and other relevant international frameworks. AGL operates key cyber security capabilities, including monitoring and defence, network security, identity and access management. AGL people are regularly trained on relevant cyber risks.
column20: Information technology assets, Cyber security, Australian Energy Sector Cyber Security Framework

column6: Substantiated complaints concerning breaches of customer privacy and losses of customer data
column13: AGL proactively manages cyber risk to limit the likelihood of inappropriate access to our systems and data and the impact of cyber security incidents through preparation and rapid response capabilities. Security vulnerabilities are managed via a dedicated threat and vulnerability management team and automated scanning platforms.\t
column20: Cyber risk management, Data security, Cybersecurity incidents
